title: Trial By Kyle's legal expert Anna Heinrich hints at personality clash with Kyle Sandilands
text:
It's the Judge Judy-inspired program that promises plenty of explosive scenes and petty arguments between litigators.

And Trial By Kyle's legal expert Anna Heinrich has hinted that she also experienced her own clashes with the show's 'judge' Kyle Sandilands during filming.

Speaking to TV week, the former Bachelor Australia star and criminal lawyer Anna described herself and the radio shock-jock as 'polar opposites'.

'We're polar opposites' The Bachelor's Anna Heinrich (L) has hinted at personality clashes with shock-jock Kyle Sandilands (R) on the set of Trial by Kyle

She said: 'I don't always agree with him and he certainly doesn't agree with me, but that's what makes it so fun.'

But despite hints of a personality clash between the two, Anna admitted the KIIS FM host was 'very professional' and 'perfect for the role'.

In the new show set to air on Thursday, Kyle has the ultimate position of power as he settles disputes between friends in a Judge Rinder style set-up.

Personality clash? Kyle (pictured centre) appears in his new show Trial by Kyle with Anna (right) and model Toks James (left)

Meanwhile, criminal lawyer Anna steps in as Kyle's legal counsel, offering guidance as he hears each case.

Anna first hit TV screens in 2013 after appearing on Australia's first season of The Bachelor with Tim Robards.

The blonde lawyer fell for Tim and the gorgeous couple became the show's first success story, before they wed earlier this year.

Cheers! Anna and her husband Tim Robards (pictured) met in 2013 on Australia's first season of The Bachelor

When asked how Kyle compares to traditional judges, Anna said: 'He's very different.'

The first episode will see participants battle it out over nose jobs, walnuts and broken beds, TV Week reports.

Trial By Kyle airs at 8.30pm on Channel Ten.
